## Schedule (Fall 2025)

-   **Lecture 1 — 03.09.2025** — Introduction; Set Theory and Logic\
-   **Lecture 2 — 10.09.2025** — Functions and Mappings\
-   **Lecture 3 — 17.09.2025** — Analysis I: Norms, Distances, Continuity\
-   **Lecture 4 — 24.09.2025** — Analysis II: Differentiation in $\mathbb{R}$ and $\mathbb{R}^n$; partial derivatives, gradients, chain rule\
-   **Lecture 5 — 01.10.2025** — Analysis III: Unconstrained optimization (critical points; first/second-derivative tests; practical examples)\
-   **Lecture 6 — 08.10.2025** — Analysis IV: Integration Techniques and Applications\
-   **Lecture 7 — 15.10.2025** — Linear Algebra I: Vectors, Matrices, Linear Systems\
-   **Lecture 8 — 22.10.2025** — Linear Algebra II: Matrix Operations, Inverses, Determinants\
-   **Lecture 9 — 29.10.2025** — Linear Algebra III: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors\
-   **Lecture 10 — 05.11.2025** — Applications: Linear Regression (matrix formulation, least squares)\
-   **Lecture 11 — 12.11.2025** — Probability I: Counting, Probability Axioms, Conditional Probability\
-   **Lecture 12 — 19.11.2025** — Probability II: Bayes’ Law, Independence, Simpson’s Paradox\
-   **Lecture 13 — 26.11.2025** — Probability III: Random Variables, Distributions, CDFs\
-   **Lecture 14 — 03.12.2025** — Final Q&A and Exam Preparation

## Contents

-   **Set Theory:** subsets, indexed families, Cartesian product; relations & operations; propositional logic, truth tables, implications, equivalence\
-   **Functions:** identity and inverse; injective/surjective/bijective; composition\
-   **Analysis:** distances, norms, continuity; limits; poly/exp/log; differentiation in $\mathbb{R}$ and $\mathbb{R}^n$ (partials, *chain rule*); **unconstrained** maxima/minima (1st/2nd derivative tests); integration (substitution, parts; applications incl. densities); linear-regression application *(if time permits)*\
-   **Linear Algebra:** vectors/matrices; SLEs & Gaussian elimination; inverses; diagonal/triangular/symmetric; trace, determinant, eigenvalues/eigenvectors\
-   **Probability:** counting; LOTP; conditional probability & Bayes’ Law; Simpson’s paradox; independence; discrete/continuous RVs; PMF/PDF/CDF
